title: I Only Want Sweaters That Exude Luxury and Sophistication This Season—32 Options I'm Considering
excerpt: If you like expensive-looking sweaters, look no further. We handpicked the 32 styles that should be in your cart right now.
text: This season, I'm leaning fully into the vibe of sweaters that keep you warm and make you feel like you've walked straight out of a cozy, understatedly chic editorial spread. Gone are the days of grabbing any old knit. Now, it's about finding pieces that exude effortless luxury. Think about that perfect, cloud-soft sweater that you'd pull on for brunch at a dimly lit café or to layer under your favorite winter coat for a stroll through Central Park. I'm convinced that the right sweater has a power—a kind of quiet sophistication that elevates even the most casual jeans and boots.As I look to add a few new knits to my rotation, I'm focusing on pieces that radiate a certain elevated charm. I'm talking about cashmere blends, refined details, and textures that catch the light just right. With a lineup of sweaters that channel this level of luxe, I won't just be prepared for cold-weather dressing. I'll be excited for it. Here's a roundup of the styles that have caught my eye, all of which have that special It factor that makes a sweater feel like an investment, not just another item on the rack. Officially my favorite thing on the internet. J.Crew Carolyn Fitted Crewneck Sweater Obsessed with the fit on this one. English Factory Argyle Cardigan Argyle will always look luxe to me. Sold Out NYC Signature Polo This looks so high-quality. Leset Pointelle Classic Crew Cardigan Here for this price point. J.Crew Cashmere Relaxed Crewneck Sweater This sweater is such a good layering option. Khaite Guy Intarsia Cashmere-Blend Sweater I'm here for a Fair Isle moment. J.Crew Cashmere Relaxed V-Neck Sweater I'm here for this V-neck moment. The Great Outdoors Shawl Collar Full Zip Sweater Did someone say happy holidays? Reformation Cashmere Boyfriend Sweater I'm obsessed with this color palette. J.Crew Johnny-Collar Sweater With Ribbed Trim I'm all about this pop of red. Alex Mill Reese Sweater in Alpaca Donegal Wool You'll wear this a million times. Guizio Mila Zip Up Jacket I'm obsessed with how classic this style is. J.Crew Relaxed Milano-Stitch Cardigan Sweater Little Lies Argyle Sweater Guest in Residence Shrunken Cashmere Sweater How to wear a sweater tied around the neck without the hassle. Guest in Residence Cashmere Sweater This crewneck moment is everything. Reformation Brooklyn Cashmere Polo Sweater Allude Wool and Cashmere-Blend Sweater Reformation Brooklyn Cotton Polo Sweater I'm obsessed with this shade of red. Guest in Residence Cable-Knit Wool and Cashmere-Blend Straight-Leg Pants The après-ski circuit isn't ready for me. A.L.C. Carter Merino Wool Blend Quarter Zip Pullover Reformation Sutton Regenerative Merino Open Knit Sweater A deep V is certainly the moment. Madewell Shrunken Cotton Blend Cardigan I'm obsessed with this one. Sporty & Rich Cable Polo Sweater Sporty & Rich has perfected the modern preppy aesthetic. Lands' End Cotton Drifter Cable Cardigan Sweater One of the latest additions to my collection. Falke Troyer Cable-Knit Wool-Blend Sweater Another great option for layering. Reformation Dana Cashmere Crew Sweater Dark red certainly is the moment. Sierra Mayhew was always destined to work in fashion, but she didn't know it at first. Growing up with no choice but to wear a rotation of school uniforms and activewear, her love for fashion really blossomed when she moved away for college and was able to finally define her very own personal style. Shortly thereafter, she interned at Elle magazine and instantly knew that editorial was for her. After graduating from the University of Notre Dame, she worked for ShopBazaar, contributing regularly to Bazaar.com, and finally made her way to Who What Wear, where she is an associate editor. When she’s not working, you can catch her always trying to catch a flight, trying the latest fitness craze in New York City, or exploring luxury vintage boutiques.
html:
This season, I'm leaning fully into the vibe of sweaters that keep you warm and make you feel like you've walked straight out of a cozy, understatedly chic editorial spread. Gone are the days of grabbing any old knit. Now, it's about finding pieces that exude effortless luxury. Think about that perfect, cloud-soft sweater that you'd pull on for brunch at a dimly lit café or to layer under your favorite winter coat for a stroll through Central Park. I'm convinced that the right sweater has a power—a kind of quiet sophistication that elevates even the most casual jeans and boots.

As I look to add a few new knits to my rotation, I'm focusing on pieces that radiate a certain elevated charm. I'm talking about cashmere blends, refined details, and textures that catch the light just right. With a lineup of sweaters that channel this level of luxe, I won't just be prepared for cold-weather dressing. I'll be excited for it. Here's a roundup of the styles that have caught my eye, all of which have that special It factor that makes a sweater feel like an investment, not just another item on the rack.

Officially my favorite thing on the internet.

J.Crew

Carolyn Fitted Crewneck Sweater

Obsessed with the fit on this one.

English Factory

Argyle Cardigan

Argyle will always look luxe to me.

Sold Out NYC

Signature Polo

This looks so high-quality.

Leset

Pointelle Classic Crew Cardigan

Here for this price point.

J.Crew

Cashmere Relaxed Crewneck Sweater

This sweater is such a good layering option.

Khaite

Guy Intarsia Cashmere-Blend Sweater

I'm here for a Fair Isle moment.

J.Crew

Cashmere Relaxed V-Neck Sweater

I'm here for this V-neck moment.

The Great

Outdoors Shawl Collar Full Zip Sweater

Did someone say happy holidays?

Reformation

Cashmere Boyfriend Sweater

I'm obsessed with this color palette.

J.Crew

Johnny-Collar Sweater With Ribbed Trim

I'm all about this pop of red.

Alex Mill

Reese Sweater in Alpaca Donegal Wool

You'll wear this a million times.

Guizio

Mila Zip Up Jacket

I'm obsessed with how classic this style is.

J.Crew

Relaxed Milano-Stitch Cardigan Sweater

Little Lies

Argyle Sweater

Guest in Residence

Shrunken Cashmere Sweater

How to wear a sweater tied around the neck without the hassle.

Guest in Residence

Cashmere Sweater

This crewneck moment is everything.

Reformation

Brooklyn Cashmere Polo Sweater

Allude

Wool and Cashmere-Blend Sweater

Reformation

Brooklyn Cotton Polo Sweater

I'm obsessed with this shade of red.

Guest in Residence

Cable-Knit Wool and Cashmere-Blend Straight-Leg Pants

The après-ski circuit isn't ready for me.

A.L.C.

Carter Merino Wool Blend Quarter Zip Pullover

Reformation

Sutton Regenerative Merino Open Knit Sweater

A deep V is certainly the moment.

Madewell

Shrunken Cotton Blend Cardigan

I'm obsessed with this one.

Sporty & Rich

Cable Polo Sweater

Sporty & Rich has perfected the modern preppy aesthetic.

Lands' End

Cotton Drifter Cable Cardigan Sweater

One of the latest additions to my collection.

Falke

Troyer Cable-Knit Wool-Blend Sweater

Another great option for layering.

Reformation

Dana Cashmere Crew Sweater

Dark red certainly is the moment.

Sierra Mayhew was always destined to work in fashion, but she didn't know it at first. Growing up with no choice but to wear a rotation of school uniforms and activewear, her love for fashion really blossomed when she moved away for college and was able to finally define her very own personal style. Shortly thereafter, she interned at Elle magazine and instantly knew that editorial was for her. After graduating from the University of Notre Dame, she worked for ShopBazaar, contributing regularly to Bazaar.com, and finally made her way to Who What Wear, where she is an associate editor. When she’s not working, you can catch her always trying to catch a flight, trying the latest fitness craze in New York City, or exploring luxury vintage boutiques.
